page.title: 03Farming in Dargate and Blean
page.content: Only a small proportion of our square is farmland, the farms are small, ranging from 50-l70 acres concentrating mainly on producing meat. The areas suitable for agriculture are undulating strips of land dividing large areas of dense woodland- 'fingers' of land with woodland boundaries on three sides which are all permanant pasture grazed by beef cattle, sheep and lambs. The one open area is towards the NW corner where larger fields allow corn and tick beans for fodder to be grown. There are two areas of orchards, both to the north of our square, in the NW at Dargate apples are grown and further east at Parsonage Farm 100 acres are planted with apples, pears and plums with a southern boundary of woodland.
